Articles.Content:
I don't know what about you but I'm hoping for some extra stuff for Christmas like Eeloo was last year. Maybe I'm just spoiled by Paradox, which released special carol for Christmas for everyone to download, but having new destination would be great.

Or maybe I'm totally wrong and we will get for instance procedural craters on Duna or more biomes.

Or maybe we won't get anything.

Well, I hope that Santa is going to be generous this year It would be especially good idea (IMHO) after all this resources system earthquake.

Edited December 22, 2013 by czokletmuss
Well if Eeloo is right now Pluto Analog My bets are on Charons analog for Eeloo. (Or gas planet two oh god please be a gas planet two, I will love you without rings I promise)
Yes! Charon analogue is a great idea; imagine the view:
I'd love a new planet!
I'd like a comet or an asteroid with a fairly eccentric orbit, as long as it's not boring like Bop.
I would love a new planet too. But i have a feeling it's not going to happen
Wasn't Eeloo supposed to become the Moon of a future gas giant?
Yeah eeloo would be a moon of gas giant two
I'd love a new planet, sadly not going to happen probably. I think that .23 was our Christmas gift.

Maybe Duna getting a second mun(Deimos analogue?). Although we don't need another Minmus.

But what we could enjoy is a Metis analogue. Basically another captured asteroid(which would be dark gray this time) that orbits Jool in a REALLY short distance(it would cover ~72% of the sky). It is tidally locked to Jool. It has a minuscule gravity and sphere of influence, so it will not often botch your Joolian aerobrake, but will still be a pain to get to(good luck not aerobraking at Jool while trying to reach it). If you thought Laythe was ridiculously close to Jool, this is for you.

Why not a comet? Highly elliptical and highly inclined.

Probably some weird shape that would make it even harder to land on.

Edited December 22, 2013 by Tex_NL
Why not? Devs may surprise us - after all, that's the whole point of a Christmas gift, right?

But what we could enjoy is a Metis analogue. Basically another captured asteroid(which would be dark gray this time) that orbits Jool in a REALLY short distance(it would cover ~72% of the sky). It is tidally locked to Jool. It has a minuscule gravity and sphere of influence, so it will not often botch your Joolian aerobrake, but will still be a pain to get to(good luck not aerobraking at Jool while trying to reach it). If you thought Laythe was ridiculously close to Jool, this is for you.

That would be so great.
a 0.625m santa hat to put in the top of my rocket!

I want to see Mu's Moon he mentioned in a Squadcast months ago or any other new celestial Body.

But even if it is not working out, I am not too upset
I'd like to see a moon for a moon

I'd like to see a moon for a moon

Like the Magic Boulder?

You know what would be an awesome Christmas present? Magic boulders for everybody!

Ed: Blast! Ninja'd again! Brain, y u not be faster!
Ooh, along the lines of another moon/Magic Boulder, we could have a moon orbiting another moon... They could call it... moonception!

Really hope to see a planetary body christmas gift. It doesn't have to be Gas Giant 2, but I would applaud a charon analogue for dres or eeloo. Or another moon for jool. Devs have stated that adding planetary bodies isn't particularly hard (and they have dozens of "test" planets), just that they don't wanna continue adding planets until more of the game is complete.

I'm a 'tad spoiled though. And just want something new to crash into.

I hope for a binary gas giant system!

I know it's been rejected, but heck, it's christmas! Don't hate me for it!
I wasn't around at the time, so I need to ask did the release of Eeloo have any rumblings beforehand, or was it out of the blue (Or the black! Ok that was bad)
Not going to happen, the devs are taking a winter holiday until January according to Max.

Not going to happen, the devs are taking a winter holiday until January according to Max.

Damn these Holidays ...

Not going to happen, the devs are taking a winter holiday until January according to Max.

Doesn't mean they haven't had something ready to go for a while, and simply need to press a button or two on Christmas morning to release it to our weird Kerbal universe.

Still, I find another planet/moon a little unlikely.
